availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Squire Mauzy and Louisa Mauzy. Resident of Ohio County in 1850. Resident of Ohio County in 1860. Farmer in Ohio County in 1865. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from February 4, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 47B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 784.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 501A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0478.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 406.
"William Harrison Mauzy (1845-1911)," Find A Grave, Memorial 53110913, accessed June 8, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53110913.
